alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:47PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Wind gusts to 55 mph and heavy rain will impact portions of northern Teton, southeastern Fremont and northeastern Madison Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 345 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Drummond, or 13 miles east of Marysville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Mesonet and radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ashton, Marysville, Felt, Tetonia, Drummond, Warm River, Tetonia Research Station, and Mesa Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for eastern and southeastern Idaho.

area.areaDesc: Big Hole Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain
